Opened issue "Binding Library properties shows class-parse but jar2xml is used by default" (#1319) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create new Android Binding Library
2. Add jar/aar (for example firebase-messaging-11.8.0.jar)
3. Open properties, Android Class Parser shows "class-parse"
4. Set MSBUILD to Diagnostic (Tools ->Options -> Projects and Solutions -> Build and Run)
5. Build
6. Output shows some JAR2XML warnings

### Expected Behavior
Class-parse being used

### Actual Behavior
Jar2xml being used

### Workaround
1. Open properties
2. Switch Android Class Parser to "jar2xml"
3. Save
4. Switch Android Class Parse to "class-parse"
5. Save

When build/rebuilding class-parse gets used.

Opened issue "Can't change RelativeLayout Constraints after update to Xamarin.Forms 2.4 " (#1915) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description
Can't change RelativeLayout Constraints after update to Xamarin.Forms 2.4 
The problem can be reproduced using official Xamarin.Forms Layout Demos
The box on this demo is not moving anymore.
I use this to position views when user rotate screen on my app.

### Steps to Reproduce
1. download official Xamarin.Forms Layout Demos (https://developer.xamarin.com/samples/xamarin-forms/UserInterface/Layout/)
2. update all solution nuget packages
run the app
3. go to RelativeLayout Demo (it's the same for XAML o C# demo)
4. touch on Move button

If you want to see this working fine, just rollback Xamarin.Forms package to 2.3.4.270, uninstall app, clean solution and run again.

### Expected Behavior
The box must move like when you are using Xamarin.Forms 2.3.4.270

### Actual Behavior
The box is not moving anymore.

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: Xamarin.Forms 2.4+
- Last known good version: Xamarin.Forms 2.3.4.270
- IDE: Visual Studio 2017
- Platform Target Frameworks: 
  - iOS:  9.x+
  - Android: 4.4+

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Enahacement] [Documentation] Update the Element class hierarchy diagram" (#1914) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Rationale

I found myself looking many times to the hierarchy diagram from here https://developer.xamarin.com/api/type/Xamarin.Forms.Element/. I think it's a great reference for developers. And I am sure I not the only one who thinks the same.
But the diagram hasn't been updated to include newer classes like TemplatedPage, TemplatedView, or TableView.

I wish it included all classes.

### Description
When a developer develops a app in Xamarin, the Business logic is written in C# and the UI is coded manually through XAML. Untill the app runs on a emulaor/device, the developer has only a vague idea(imagination) of the UI developed. Thus this project focuses on building "the GUI based design element" in Xamarin-forms. (It is inspired by android studio).

### Expected Behavior
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25129720/36352516-1aa4896a-14e0-11e8-9835-89e455ee9be1.png)


https://drive.google.com/open?id=0Bx5OwGPUWtTvMmJMMmMxWm05S01iVFltMmRLMk5pUHFMQVVv

The project plans to provide the facility of the  canvas on which widgets can be dropped from the adjacent widget-palette. It also aims at the creation of the design and text tabs, where-in the XAML code will be auto-generated as per the designed UI. 

### Actual Behavior
![image 1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25129720/36352520-2272bb6c-14e0-11e8-883e-73450bbb733c.png)

https://drive.google.com/file/d/0Bx5OwGPUWtTvWWhPdW9tR0d4cmZ2RUthVEstTUFtZDk5d3g4/view?usp=sharing

(Use drive links if image is not accessiable)

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Setup application to load HTML5 audio page in WKWebView
2. WKWebView MediaTypesRequiringUserActionForPlayback configuration set for 'None' 
3. Run app to see if audio autostarts

One should note that the same code for iOS Swift works without a problem.

### Expected Behavior
The audio should play on page load.
### Actual Behavior
The audio does not play and requires user interaction to start the audio. Does not respect the MediaTypesRequiringUserActionForPlayback param.
